snippet: Native advertising is advertising that wears the uniform of journalism, mimicking the storytelling aesthetic of the host site. Some say it could dilute the power of a brand over time.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column contends native advertising on the Internet is the new rage; describes it as advertising that wears the uniform of journalism, mimicking the storytelling aesthetic of the host site; notes some observers say it could dilute the power of a brand over time.
lead_paragraph: Native advertising is advertising that wears the uniform of journalism, mimicking the storytelling aesthetic of the host site. Some say it could dilute the power of a brand over time.

headline.main: Storytelling Ads May Be Journalism’s New Peril
headline.print_headline: Storytelling Ads May Be Journalism’s New Peril
